posts.post_text: November 3, 2014 at 6:20 AM#2If you select your fixtures first, this one will work.store group 999 /oifoutput @if group 999delete group 999 /ncThis one will ask the user to specify which value range that should be included.If you only want to read the fixtures above zero, skip the @ (or simply press enter when the the ifoutput keyword appears in the cmdline)

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: November 3, 2014 at 11:36 PM#4IfOutput->select all channels with output above zeroIf Channel 1 Thru 100->but of those with output, only ch 1 thru 100At 50should do the job,- basically the same as Ivers macro, intersect two selections via the if keyword.one group being all with output, second group your given range, the intersection would be the channels in the given group that has output.if you want to save a few keystrokes, your macro could go:CodeClearSelectionIfOutputIf @the @ will halt the macro mid-command and let you finish off with your range and targetvalue: Channel 1 Thru 100 at 50
